In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existan

---

In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way. Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existence or listen to a short sci fi novella from the 1980's.  I can do all this while taking care of my most basic needs.   It makes my life more efficient and enjoyable by freeing up time for other activities while at the same time I am at the end of the day learning new and most

In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existence or listen to a short sci fi novella from the 1980's.  I can do all this while taking care of my most basic needs.   It makes my life more efficient and enjoyable by freeing up time for other activities while at the same time I am at the end of the

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existence or listen to a short sci fi novella from the 1980's.  I can do all this while taking care of my most basic needs. In my opinion, I think current audio books are much more efficient at teaching and entertaining compared to reading old text books or paperbacks. There are a number of reasons why I think this way. The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existence or listen to a short sci fi novella from the 1980's.  I can do all this while taking care of my most basic needs and learning new and exciting

The first reason is simply convenience. You can store thousands of books right onto your phone without taking up much space and they are available anytime in a very organized easy to find way.  Other reasons would be because I can listen to them while commuting, working out, walking on the beach, and doing pretty much anything else. I am sure reading has its benefits as well and I still do plenty of that in the forms of email, reports, news and other vital/interesting information but after doing that all day I do not want to go home and cozy up with a nice book and read some more. No, I want to cook dinner and listen to how the universe came into existence or listen to a short sci fi novella from the 1980's.  I can do all this while taking care of my most basic needs and learning new and exciting things on a daily basis. That's why I prefer aud
